org.j2free.cache
Interface Fragment

All Known Implementing Classes:
MemoryFragment
@ThreadSafe
public interface Fragment

Implementations of Fragment MUST be thread-safe.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String get(long waitFor, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
          If the content of this Fragment has not yet been initialized, this method will block until either (1) it is initialized, or (2) waitFor has passed.
 boolean isLockAbandoned()
           
 boolean tryLockForUpdate()
          This try will attempt to force-lock the fragment for update regardless of condition or expiration status.
 boolean tryLockForUpdate(java.lang.String condition)
          Atomic bundling of a few tasks: (a) Check if this fragment is expired (b) Check if the condition under which this fragment was created has expired (c) Check that no other Thread currently has a lock-for-update on this Fragment - If (a || b) && c then lock this Fragment for update by the calling Thread and return true; otherwise return false.
 void tryRelease()
          Attemtps to release the lock if the current thread holds it, otherwise does nothing.
 boolean tryUpdateAndRelease(java.lang.String content, java.lang.String condition)
          Checks that the caller Thread owns the update lock; if so updates the content and notifies other threads that may be waiting to get the content, otherwise returns false.
 

Method Detail

get

java.lang.String get(long waitFor,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
If the content of this Fragment has not yet been initialized, this method will block until either (1) it is initialized, or (2) waitFor has passed. Otherwise, it will return content immediately, even if currently locked for update.

Parameters:
waitFor - how long to wait
unit - the TimeUnit to wait for
Returns:
the content
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

isLockAbandoned

boolean isLockAbandoned()
Returns:
true if the Fragment is locked and the lockWait has passed, otherwise false.

tryLockForUpdate

boolean tryLockForUpdate(java.lang.String condition)
Atomic bundling of a few tasks: (a) Check if this fragment is expired (b) Check if the condition under which this fragment was created has expired (c) Check that no other Thread currently has a lock-for-update on this Fragment - If (a || b) && c then lock this Fragment for update by the calling Thread and return true; otherwise return false.

Parameters:
condition - A condition which, if changed since the last update, should trigger an update.
Returns:
true if this fragment has been locked for update by the calling thread, otherwise false

tryLockForUpdate

boolean tryLockForUpdate()
This try will attempt to force-lock the fragment for update regardless of condition or expiration status. It is meant to be used to refresh the cache due to a manual request.

Returns:
true if this fragment has been locked for update by the calling thread, otherwise false

tryUpdateAndRelease

boolean tryUpdateAndRelease(java.lang.String content,
                            java.lang.String condition)
Checks that the caller Thread owns the update lock; if so updates the content and notifies other threads that may be waiting to get the content, otherwise returns false.

Parameters:
content - the content to set
condition - the current condition
Returns:

tryRelease

void tryRelease()
Attemtps to release the lock if the current thread holds it, otherwise does nothing.
